headline: Fed rate inaction is a 'benign scenario' for banking sector
summary: The Federal Reserve announced on Wednesday that it is holding rates steady. HSBC head of US financials research Saul Martinez joins Market Domination host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance Markets Reporter Josh Schafer to examine how financial stocks (XLF) will be impacted, noting that the Fed's decision not to lower interest rates is "benign" for the sector. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Citigroup (NYSE:C) Urges Shareholders To Reject Executive Pay Proposal At April Meeting
summary: Last week, Citigroup (NYSE:C) urged its shareholders to oppose a governance proposal concerning executive compensation at its upcoming annual meeting. During the same period, the company strategically redeemed over $2 billion in senior notes, aligning with its liability management plans. These corporate events unfolded as the Dow Jones and other major U.S. indexes trended upwards, with investors eagerly anticipating insights from the Federal Reserve's policy meeting. Against this backdrop,...

headline: Citigroup Slashes Top Executives Bonus in 2024 for Regulatory Fixes
summary: C reduces top executives' bonuses in 2024 tied to the bank's turnaround results and risk management fixes required by regulators.

headline: Citi Slashes Bonuses, Morgan Stanley Cutting Jobs
summary: Citigroup will cut bonuses for top executives as part of a "Transformation Bonus Program." Meanwhile, Morgan Stanley is planning on cutting 2,000 jobs later this month. Sridhar Natarajan and Sally Bakewell report on "Bloomberg Open Interest."

raw.headline: Citi Slashes Bonuses, Morgan Stanley Cutting Jobs
raw.summary: Citigroup will cut bonuses for top executives as part of a "Transformation Bonus Program." Meanwhile, Morgan Stanley is planning on cutting 2,000 jobs later this month. Sridhar Natarajan and Sally Bakewell report on "Bloomberg Open Interest."

headline: Citi delivers lead to LME warehouses for profitable rent deals
summary: Significant amounts of lead have been deposited in London Metal Exchange (LME) approved warehouses by Citigroup for so-called rent-sharing deals over the past few days, three sources familiar with the matter said.  Rent deals are profitable agreements under which LME-registered warehouses share fees or rental income with companies that deliver metal to them.  It is not known exactly how much lead Citi delivered to LME warehouses.

headline: BlackRock Equity Dividend V.I. Fund Q4 2024 Commentary
summary: The fund posted a return of -3.56% (Class I shares) for the fourth quarter of 2024. The largest exposures were in the financials, health care, and industrials sectors.
